page.title: 04TRAFFIC-FREE ROADS
page.content: To reach the area and cover distances within, it is necessary to be a motorist or, at the very least, be on two wheels. Turning off the A43 between Oxford and Northampton and following the signposts is to enter another world of almost traffic-free roads, apart from the occasional car (inevitably belonging to a local), or tractor. Only television aerials are a reminder of 2Oth century life. There are no shops, no schools, no traffic lights, no garages, no double-yellow parking lines, no bus service and, most striking of all, no pedestrians on foot between villages. The vast empty acres serve to emphasise the screech of British and American jet age air traffic overhead. .
